meanings.definition: With the head in front; diving or falling with the head foremost.
meanings.sent1: She dove headfirst into the pool, making a big splash.
meanings.sent2: The diver entered the water headfirst, creating a perfect arc.
meanings.sent3: He decided to go headfirst into the challenge, not realizing the depth of the task.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm for the project propelled her headfirst into the work.
meanings.sent5: The child jumped headfirst into the pile of leaves, giggling with joy.

meanings.definition: In a reckless or impulsive manner; without thinking or planning.
meanings.sent1: He acted headfirst without considering the consequences.
meanings.sent2: She rushed headfirst into the decision, later regretting her haste.
meanings.sent3: The puppy ran headfirst into the glass door, mistaking it for an open space.
meanings.sent4: The car sped headfirst into the intersection, narrowly avoiding a collision.
meanings.sent5: The student tackled the exam headfirst, hoping for the best outcome.
